p.s: The given text is an excerpt from Disgraced, Scene 3, written by the americanAmerican author Ayad Akhtar, and published in 2013.

Disgraced, Scene 3 is a drama, that deals and talks about many taboo subjects from a US point of view, such as islamophobia, whether 9/11 was a good thing, racism, antisemitism, whether the Quran allows you to use domestic violence etc.
The excerpt is about two married people cheating and how it affects them and their partners.
Before the excerpt begins, Amir, Emily's, husband, made controversial statements about 9/11 feeling like a win to him.
This caused the situation to become tense and Isaac, who is now alone with Emily, to talk bad about Amir to Emily.
He is about to kiss Emily when the apartment door opens and Jory, now upset, and Amir, upset because of Jory, walk in on them.
Emily and Isaac say that they had only hugged, while Jory insists that they kissed and therefore cheated on Jory and Amir.
Amir accuses Jory of lying and wanting to destroy his marriage.
